Class Course

java.lang.Object
Course
public class Course
extends java.lang.Object
This class defines a Course object which is a school course about a specific Subject. It provides all the properties and methods necessary to manage a Course in the bigger context of the School. A Course object contains all the properties getters and setters, and methods to enroll a Student, assign an Instructor, get the size of the course, let the course advance for a day, and pretty-print all course's details.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Giovanni Arcudi

  • Constructor Details

    • Course

      public Course​(Subject subject, int daysUntilStarts)
      Creates a Course object and initializes the subject, daysUntilStarts, daysToRun and enrolledStudents properties using the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      subject - the subject associated with the course
      daysUntilStarts - the number of days until the course starts
      Throws:
      InvalidInputException - If the number of days until the course starts is not a positive integer

  • Method Details

    • getSubject

      public Subject getSubject()
      Course's Subject accessor method.
      Returns:
      the subject associated with the course

    • getStatus

      public int getStatus()
      Course's status accessor method. If the course has not started, then returns the negative of the number of days until the course starts. If the course is currently running, then returns the number of days left until the course finishes. If the course has finished, then returns 0.
      Returns:
      the status of the course

    • isCancelled

      public boolean isCancelled()
      Returns whether or not the course has been cancelled.
      Returns:
      true if the course has been cancelled, false otherwise

    • setInstructor

      public boolean setInstructor​(Instructor instructor)
      Tries to assign the Instructor passed as parameter to this course.
      Parameters:
      instructor - the instructor we want to set for the course
      Returns:
      true if the instructor can teach the course, false otherwise

    • getInstructor

      public Instructor getInstructor()
      Course's Instructor accessor method.
      Returns:
      the instructor of the course

    • hasInstructor

      public boolean hasInstructor()
      Returns whether or not the course has an instructor
      Returns:
      true if the course has an instructor, false otherwise

    • enrolStudent

      public boolean enrolStudent​(Student student)
      Adds the Student object passed as parameter to the collection of enrolledStudents.
      Parameters:
      student - the student to enrol
      Returns:
      false
      • if the course is full (each course has a maximum of 3 students)
      • or if it has already started
      • or if the student has already graduated from that course
      • or if the student has not the prerequisites for the subject taught in the course
      true
      • otherwise

    • getStudents

      public Student[] getStudents()
      Returns an array containing all the students enrolled in the course.
      Returns:
      the Student[] array of students enrolled in the course

    • getStudentsArrayList

      public java.util.ArrayList<Student> getStudentsArrayList()
      Returns the array list of all the students enrolled in the course.
      Returns:
      the Student array list of students enrolled in the course

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the course size.
      Returns:
      the number of students enrolled in the course

    • aDayPasses

      public void aDayPasses()
      Advances one day for the course. It reduces by one the daysUntilStarts if the course has not started, or the daysToRun if it has started. It also:
      • Cancels the course if it is starting without any instructor or students, releasing the instructor (if any) and the students (if any) from the course.
      • If the course finishes, then issues the certificate for the courseâ€™s subject to all the students in the course and unassign the instructor from the course.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a pretty-print string of the Course, containing all its details.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a table-formatted string containing the course's subject, status, instructor and enrolled students
